content.description: Jam a through a steep start on the obvious crack, following easier ground to a two bolt anchor with tat.
content.location: On the smooth dark face, lower left of the amphitheater. The obvious crack

content.description: Start at the lowest spot in the center of the wall. Climb perfect dark rock past 4 horizontals with good gear aiming for the arcing overlap, classic Ibex bulges. Pass a thin vertical seam, then layback and undercling following the overlap to the chains at the lip. Probably an uneventful top rope, but this one is a memorable lead with just enough gear!
content.protection: Single rack to 1, micro cams, RPs. 2 bolts and chains
content.location: Bottom left of the amphitheater on a smooth dark face with multiple horizontal cracks. The backside of New Year's Rock

content.description: Chimney up past 4 bolts. Once the gap flares open, stem wide above a slabby bolt and clip the bolt high on the right face. Commit to the right face completely and traverse right through a hidden sequence to a big sandy hueco. Pull final thin moves straight up to the anchors. Airy for the grade!
content.location: Back center of the Amphitheater Rocks in an obvious chimney. Look for black painted hangers up the right chimney wall.
